TitleFalse.en-us: Keep fields locked, as you shouldn't edit it here

TitleTrue.en-us: I need to make some manual changes

Notes.*: The title is auto-generated, but you can add more text if you need to

Notes.en-us: The target is what will be updated. Choose a value or type your own key in advanced cases.

DropdownValues.en-us:
Field.Value:Field Value
Field.Settings.Name:Name (Title) of the Field
Field.Settings.Notes:Notes / Help of the Field
Field.Settings.Visible:Visible (show the Field)
Field.Settings.Required:Required (must be filled in)
Field.Settings.Disabled:Disabled (blocked, can't be edited)

TitleIndeterminate.*: Show notes if it has any

Notes.en-us: Do not use this any more, please use notes instead. This will be removed ca. 2023.

EditInstructions.en-us:
Use Formulas to calculate values or settings like visibility of fields. See documentation.

⚠️ Important: Do not edit the formulas here! ⚠️

The formulas are stored here as simple data, but it's not the right place to edit them, unless you have to fix a formula that breaks your form. The right place to edit formulas is directly in the Edit Form.

Notes.*: This looks complicated, but it just ensures that the title is automatically set to better ensure people use the right target.

Title.*: Setting Disabled: Disable if not enabled
Setting Disabled: Disable if formula is not enabled
Setting Visible: InEditUI: Show if set to show or has content
Setting Visible: InEditUI: hide if true

Notes.*: Don't allow this information to be translated - for example when the user presses translate-all
These assets are only for the new Angular form in 2sxc 10.
When enabled, the various wrappers are ensured which provide ADAM functionality.

Description.*: Input type definition for a content-type

EditInstructions.*:
These objects must be attached to the content type to have an affect - so create them as metadata for a content type so they will be exported together with the content-type definition. 

You only need to create this object for content-types which need extra configuration, so you won't find an input type in this list for every type which exists.

ListInstructions.*:
These objects must be attached to the content type to have an affect - so create them as metadata for a content type so they will be exported together with the content-type definition. 

Note that the primary list for input-types is all global types with @ in front of the name, so you only need to create this object (as metadata) for content-types which need extra configuration. You won't find an input type in this list for every type which exists.

Notes.*: Just a nice title for your convenience, so you know what this regex is for.
Message to show to the user if the expression fails.

Normally an expression is ok, if the regex matches the value found. In some cases, you would rather say "it shouldn't match the expression" for blacklisting certain things. So if you want the expression to not match, then activate this toggle.

EditInstructions.*: Configur a regular expression check here. It will usually be used in JavaScript, so make sure your RegEx adheres to the JavaScript RegEx standard. You can develop/test your regex in online tools like the RegExr.
